data.title: Duplicate workspace setting warnings

data.title: Get extensions behind a proxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:55:32.357Z)
- OS Version: Linux ia32 4.4.0-59-generic
- Extensions:
none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

Hello, i'am trying setup any extension using proxy-server and get error in developer console
`"workbench.main.js:132 POST https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/_apis/public/gallery/extensionquery net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED"`

![vscode_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6270201/22463482/6a83e83a-e7ba-11e6-8fe5-1e842454b2b1.png)

data.title: API doesnt update settings if there are trailing commas in settings.json
data.body:
Users of my Settings sync extension having problems https://github.com/shanalikhan/code-settings-sync/issues/190

When they have trailing commas in settings.json , API doenst allow extension to add keys and values in settings.json file , Giving error code `4`.

There should be way in code to let users know that they dont have valid JSON in settings.json file e.g trailing commas, without opening that file may be in status bar or let API to add settings in the settings.json file even it have trailing commas.

data.title: Adopt "php.validate.executablePath" handling to new TS behaviour
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.
- OS Version: all

"php.validate.executablePath" should behave in the following way:

- the setting can be set in the user and workspace settings
- if present in the workspace setting warn the user once that the setting starts an executable and that the user trust the executable.
- if the workspace setting changes (points to a different executable) ask again.

data.title: Cannot set shortcuts of Ctrl + symbols
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607 (64-bit Traditional Chinese)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open File -> Preferences -> Keyboard Shortcuts
2. Type Ctrl + K to define keybinding.
3. Type Ctrl + [will get a ctrl + unknown as screenshot below.
![q1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6713645/22460341/5dbdc330-e7df-11e6-891e-8687a9bcd4fa.png)

Will get the same problem with other combination such as:

- ctrl + ;
- ctrl + ,

data.title: Copy line does not work properly with multi-cursor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1 .Invoke the "Insert cursor below" or "Inser cursor above" command.
2. Invoke the "Copy line (empty selection)" command.
3. Paste from the clipboard at some arbitrary place in the document.

Results:

One empty line is appended below the cursor.

Expected behaviour:

The copied lines are appended below the cursor.

data.title: Tasks don't work with substs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.6|
|omnipascal|Wosi|0.12.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have the following substs:

CMD:
C:\>subst
G:\: => C:\ERP\5.8.master\framework\svcl-fontes\svcl\resources\hudson\delphi
K:\: => Z:\svcl-fontes\pkg
M:\: => C:\ERP\5.8.master\framework\svcl-fontes\runtime
P:\: => C:\ERP\5.8.master\gestao-empresarial-fontes\erp-g5-rec\fontes
Q:\: => C:\ERP\5.8.master\gestao-empresarial-fontes\erp-g5-rec
Z:\: => C:\ERP\5.8.master\framework

2. When i open the P:\ in vscode, even when i have a tasks.json configured (i tried with the documentation example below), the task don't appear with ctrl + p and writting "task ".

tasks.json:
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "echo",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [],
    "showOutput": "always",
    "echoCommand": true,
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "hello",
            "args": ["Hello World"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "bye",
            "args": ["Good Bye"]
        }
    ]
}

3. When i access the absolute folder (without the subst), the tasks works fine.

data.title: HTML Formatting Breaks when ul tag has style attribute
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: Mac OSX 10.11.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an HTML file, or a new blank file and choose HTML from the bottom right 2. Pase the following markup in: ```
``` 3. Run format document 4. **Expected**: the `li` tags should indent 5. Remove the `style` attribute from the `ul` tag 6. Run format document 7. Now it's working w/o the `style` attribute, the `li` tags will indent.

data.title: Repl suggest widget is broken
data.body:
Related to #18751 and #11944

In the repl: press <kbd>Cmd Space</kbd> and then <kbd>Enter</kbd>. It will open the suggest widget, choose the first suggestion and then submit that value. This is incredibly frustrating, especially if the value the user picks is a method.

data.title: Bad font rendering on linux

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.10

The font rendering on VSCode is pretty bad on linux. To find out the reason, I downloaded a simple electron app from [electron-quick-start](https://github.com/electron/electron-quick-start) and found out that the font rendering on it was pretty good, this small electron app used the following components:

* Node.js 6.5.0
* Chromium 53.0.2785.143
* Electron 1.4.15.

Screenshots(font: ubuntu):

VSCode
![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3351317/22457420/5d42f5fe-e7d2-11e6-9ad9-adf0a4be0c17.png)

electron
![electron](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3351317/22457437/6a347fee-e7d2-11e6-9bc3-0bfd38e0e10a.png)

Maybe this is not so obvious, but in my computer the font rendering in electron is a lot better than VSCode. Everything on the editor seems to be blurry in VSCode.

data.title: Recommended extension is not displayed on the list
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:
0. Make sure that redhat.java extension is not installed
1. Open a .java file 
2. Observe that `It is recommended to install the 'Language Support for Java(TM) by Red Hat' extension.` message is displayed. Select `Show Recommendations`
3. redhat.java extension is not listed as part of the recommended extensions list, hence user can not install it.

data.title: Add activationEvents addition to 'detectProcess' for extension registration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win 10 RS1

I'm working on an extension for vscode to integrate with another program (so I can use vscode as the editor for developing for that program).  I'd usually have that tool running when working on code for it.

Therefore, it'd be great if I could activate my extension if vscode detects that application/process is running on the system.  Then, I wouldn't have to add a file to my project directory to autoload via some other method as it's using a general language.

Process name should support spaces.

data.title: All installed callstack context menu items are shown during every debug session
data.body:
I always assumed that during a debugging session, I'd only see the context menu items contributed by the active debug adapter. But in prepping the chrome extension to release, I just realized that I see all of them during every debug session.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/22452769/924088a6-e72e-11e6-808a-128647d84c9e.png)

This is a Go debug session, and I see callstack context menu items from node2 and chrome. They don't do anything. I think they should both be hidden. Normally if you have the Chrome extension installed, you'll see two instances of "toggle skipping this file".

@isidorn @weinand

data.title: Ctrl+`  toggle terminal Shortcut key failure
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open vscode
2. switch to another program, then switch back to vscode, the **Ctrl+`** will out of action

It always happen. When I launch vscode, I can use the "Ctrl+`" normally. Once I switch to another program then switch back to, the "Ctrl+`" will out of action. I must use the Ctrl+Shift+P and enter ">view: toggle integrated terminal" to toggle terminal.

data.title: When trying to start a launch config with invalid type, "pick environment" picker shows up and doesn't do anything
data.body:
- Create a launch config with `"type": "foo"`
- Have some .ts file open
- Try to start the launch config
- Nothing happens

Here, it should say "foo" isn't supported

- Open launch.json, and try to start the launch config
- "Select environment" shows up
- Pick an option - nothing happens
- Then a second later, "foo isn't supported" shows up

I don't think the environment picker should show up unless it adds valid launch configs to the launch.json file.

data.title: Relabel "Call Stack" to "Threads"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: All

The "Call Stack" viewlet is actually a list of threads until a breakpoint is hit, at which point one of the threads expands to show the call stack. The viewlet should be renamed to "Threads".

data.title: Windows 10 Multiple Desktops issue
data.body: On Windows 10 I have multiple desktops set up.  On desktop 1 I had an instance of VSCode open.  I switch to desktop 2 and try to start another instance of VSCode but it switches me back to desktop 1 and the previously opened instance of code.  Would expect to open another instance that is pinned to desktop 2.

data.title: New tsdk flow for 19
data.body:
Based on feedback in #19451 

Allows users to opt into using their workspace typescript.tsdk setting to specify the path to their typescript install.

Also, fixes a bug when the global tsdk setting points to the workspace version of typescript, our ts selector interface can get confused on which version is currently active. The fix adds a check using the local storage value to show the correct active version.

data.title: Allow using workspace typescript.tsdk setting
data.body:
Allows users to opt into using their workspace typescript.tsdk setting to specify the path to their typescript install.

Also, fixes a bug when the global tsdk setting points to the workspace version of typescript, our ts selector interface can get confused on which version is currently active. The fix adds a check using the local storage value to show the correct active version.

data.title: Handle typescript.tsdk path does not exist with wrong sub directory better
TS version prompt shows non-existent path when ts not present
data.body:
- Ubuntu
- Have workspace settings with a tsdk set
- Have typescript not actually installed
- Open a ts file and click the version number

Strange that it shows this path, which doesn't exist:

data.title: Feature request: Enable find dialog on extension information panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Gnome Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the extension panel
2. Click on an extension to open the information panel
3. Click on Edit menu, select find or use the keyboard shortcut (i.e ctrl+f) but no search dialog pops up in the information panel

It would be great to be able to search for terms in the extension information panel in any of its tabs: details, contributions, changelog, etc
